edu.vserver.exercises.model
Interface Executor<E extends ExerciseData,S extends SubmissionInfo>

Type Parameters:
E - ExerciseData instances of which can be executed with this implementor
S - SubmissionInfo in which this executor stores info about submissions
All Superinterfaces:
java.io.Serializable
All Known Implementing Classes:
ExerTypeVoidImplCollection.RealSimpleExerciseExecutor
public interface Executor<E extends ExerciseData,S extends SubmissionInfo>
extends java.io.Serializable

An implementor of this class knows how to execute certain exercise-instance defined by certain ExerciseData of given exercise-type.

Author:
Riku Haavisto, Johannes Holvitie

Method Detail

initialize

void initialize(ResourceGiver localizer,
                E exerciseData,
                S oldSubm,
                ExerciseMaterialManager materials,
                ExecutionSettings execSettings)
                throws ExerciseException
Loads the executor with data. This method must be called before calling other methods of the executor to initialize the executor.

Parameters:
localizer - ResourceGiver making it possible to localize UI
exerciseData - ExerciseData object to be loaded for the executor
oldSubm - SubmissionInfo of old submission that can be shown to the user (optional); null if there is no prior submission
materials - ExerciseMaterialManager giving all the ExerciseMaterials that might be attached to this exercise-instance through EditorMaterialManager
execSettings - ExecutionSettings that might affect how the Executor should behave
Throws:
ExerciseException - if something goes wrong in the initialization (eg. a failure to fetch critical resources)

registerSubmitListener

void registerSubmitListener(SubmissionListener<S> submitListener)
Listeners registered through this method are called when a successful submission is made (can also be a save-submission as defined by SubmissionType.

Parameters:
submitListener - the SubmissionListener to register

getView

Component getView()
Returns:
The GUI through which the user can execute certain exercise-instance

shutdown

void shutdown()

Informs the Executor that it will be shut-down and it should perform any clean-up it might need.

This method might be called more than once. Calls after clen-up is done must be ignored.

askReset

void askReset()
Asks the executor to reset the current situation of the execution and load the state again from the info given in | initialize()-method. Succeeds (at least after some delay) if the executor is in suitable ExecutionState.

askSubmit

void askSubmit(SubmissionType askedSubmType)

Asks the executor to submit a SubmissionFeedback-object from the current state of the execution and inform listeners registered through registerSubmitListener(SubmissionListener). Succeeds (at least after some delay) if the executor is in suitable ExecutionState.

SubmissionType given as a parameter must be passed to the SubmissionFeedback-object used as such as the external system uses that info to know how to handle each submissions (are they for example only saving the current state of the exercise or are they real submissions for which to show feedback etc.). It should also be noted that no error messages etc. should be shown to the user in case of a back-ground submission (#isBackgroundSubmission()) that fails because of the state of the executor.

Parameters:
askedSubmType - What kind of submissions should be done

registerExecutionStateChangeListener

void registerExecutionStateChangeListener(ExecutionStateChangeListener execStateListener)
Listeners registered through this method are called whenever the ExecutionState of the executor changes.

Parameters:
execStateListener - ExecutionStateChangeListener to register

getCurrentExecutionState

ExecutionState getCurrentExecutionState()
Returns:
the current ExecutionState of the executor
